lines.text: You know I don't like to wear any underwear, don't you, Nick?
Killing isn't like smoking. You can stop.
There are cum stains all over the sheets.
Very impressive.
He got off before he got offed.
Nick, when you recollect your childhood, are your recollections pleasing to you?

Number 1, I don't remember how often I used to jerk off, but it was a lot. Number 2, I wasn't pissed off at my dad, even when I was old enough to know what he and mom were doing in the bedroom. Number 3, I don't look in the toilet before I flush it. Number 4, I haven't wet my bed for a long time. Number 5, why don't the two of you go fuck yourselves; I'm outta here.
I thought you said he was a rock and roll star.
He was a retired rock and roll star.
A civic-minded, very respectable rock and roll star.
What's that over there?
It looks like some civic-minded, very respectable cocaine to me, Gus.
[last lines]
What do we do now, Nick?
Fuck like minks, raise rugrats and live happily ever after.
Hate rugrats.
Fuck like minks, forget the rugrats, and live happily ever after.
There's no smoking in this building, detective.

[repeating Catherine]
What are you gonna do? Charge me with smoking?
So where is this going?
Ask me "What do you want from me Catherine?"
What the fuck do you want from Catherine?
Did you kill Mr Boz, Miss Tramell?
I'd have to be pretty stupid to write a book about killing and then kill him the way I described in my book. I'd be announcing myself as the killer. I'm not stupid.
Did you ever do drugs with Mr. Boz?
Sure.
What kind of drugs?
Cocaine. Have you ever fucked on cocaine, Nick? It's nice.
[Catherine Tramell uncrosses her legs and it can be seen she's wearing no underwear]
You like playing games don't you?
I have a degree in psychology, it goes with the turf... Games are fun.
Well, she got that magna cum laude pussy on her that done fried up your brain!
What's your new book about?
A detective. He falls for the wrong woman.
What happens to him?
She kills him.
Everyone that she plays with dies.
Let me ask you something, Rocky, man to man. I think she's the fuck of the century, what do you think?
Are you a pro?
No, I'm an amateur.
What did Manny Vasquez call you?
"Bitch" mostly, but he meant it affectionately.
There's no smoking in this building, Detective.

[repeating Catherine]
What are you going to do? Charge me with smoking?
Where in the fuck you've been? I went over to your place.
Easy, cowboy, easy. I wasn't there.
I went over last night, too.
No, I wasn't there either.
You fucked her? Goddamn dumb son of a bitch, you fucked her! Goddamn, you are one dumb son of a bitch!
Next time I'll use the rubber.

[knocks on the door at Nick's apartment]
Nick! Nick, are you there?
Go away, Beth! I don't want to see you.

[unlocks the door and enters the apartment, finding Nick drinking]
I still have my keys.
Put 'em on the table and leave.
[pause]

[shouts]
Put 'em on the goddamn table and leave!

[throws the keys on the floor]
Damn it! Don't shut me out, you owe me more than that!
I don't owe you anything! And you don't owe me anything. We went to bed 10, maybe 15 times. That's miserable enough to carry an obligation.
Sometimes I really hate you.
Oh, then why don't you get yourself some friendly little therapist and try to work out all that hostility. Then maybe you can get off once in a while.
I'm in love with you already, but I'll nail you anyway.
You got goddamned Tweety Birds flutterin' around your head, that's what you got! You think you can fuck like minks, raise rugrats, and live happily ever after? Aw, man!
Do you believe Lieutenant Nilsen deserved to die?
I didn't know him well enough. I won't miss him.
Got some coke?
I've got a Pepsi in the fridge.
So was she ever a suspect?
Nope! There was some talk, but it never panned out.
What kind of talk?
Girlfriend!
What he had a girlfriend?
No! She did! But like I said, it never panned out.
[Nick just had rough sex with Beth]
You've never been like that before. Why?
You tell me, you're the shrink.
You weren't making love to me!
Well, who was I making love to?
You weren't making love at all.
Were you ever engaged in any sadomasochistic activity?
Exactly what did you have in mind, Mr. Correli?
Writing a book about it gives you an alibi for not killing him.
Yes it does, doesn't it?
How did you feel when I told you Johnny Boz had died, that day at the beach?
I felt somebody had read my book and was playing a game.
But you didn't hurt.
No.
Because you didn't love him.
That's right.
Even though you were fucking him.
You still get the pleasure. Didn't you ever fuck anybody else while you were married, Nick?

[Nick finds out that Beth and Catherine had slept together in college]
What was I supposed to say? "Hey, guys, I'm not gay, but I did fuck your suspect"?
I'm working my ass off, I'm off the sauce, I even stopped smoking.
How's not smoking?
It sucks.
[first lines]
Who was this fuckin' guy?
Rock and roll, Gus. Johnny Boz.
Never heard of him.
Before your time, cowboy.
What is this? Some kind of JOKE?
You wanna play hard, come on!
I don't buy it! There's gotta be somebody there, who knows whats going on.
I KNOW WHAT HAPPENED ALRIGHT! Catherine told me and everything she said has checked out!
You've got Goddamn tweety birds flying around your head! You think the two of you will fuck like minks, raise rugrats, and live happily ever after!
How's your new book coming along?
It's practically writing itself.
Everyone she plays with dies.
I know what that's like.
Hey Nick!
What?
Keep your three o'clock!
You want me to work the case!
I SAID KEEP IT!
ALRIGHT! I'll keep it.
Sometimes I hate you.
Oh, why don't you get one of those friendly therapists and work out all that hostility.
How did you find out?
I have friends, I have attorneys. Money buys alot of Attorneys and friends.

[TV Version]
Have you ever had sex on cocaine, Nick?
Look, I don't really feel like talking anymore.
Listen, lady, we can do this downtown, if you want.
So read me my rights and arrest me., and then I'll go downtown. Otherwise, get the fuck out of here...
Please?
You working on another book?
Yes, I am.
It must really be something making stuff up all the time.
Yeah, it teaches you to lie.
Do you have something against ice cubes?

[setting down the ice pick]
I like rough edges.
Forgive me for asking, and I don't mean to belabor the obvious, but why've you got your head so far up your ass
She wants to play. Fine, I can play.
Everybody she plays with dies.
Something's going on. You're sleeping with her, aren't you?
Why are you interested in her?
My interest is in you, not her. She seduces and manipulates people. She'll do anything she can.
I thought you hardly knew her?
I know the type. I'm a psychologist.
That means... you manipulate people too! You're a practicing psychologist. You're better at it than she is!
Killing isn't like smoking. You can quit.
Somebody has to die.
Why?
Somebody always does.
